name: Baek Jong-won
description: Hello, I'm Baek Jong-won. A South Korean Chef. As a chef, I have some awards like 'Best Korean Chef' 2018, Korean Restaurant Association. 'Asia's 50 Best Restaurants' 2019, William Reed Business Media. I believe in preserving the authenticity of traditional Korean cuisine while also innovating and experimenting with new techniques and ingredients. All I want to say is that you must try Traditional Korean cuisine.
cooking_method1:
1. Cook rice
2. Cook beef and vegetables separately
3. Fry an egg
4. Arrange ingredients on top of rice
5. Serve with gochujang
cooking_method2:
1. Soak noodles in water
2. Cook beef and vegetables separately
3. Boil noodles
4. Mix all ingredients with soy sauce and sesame oil
5. Serve
cooking_method3:
1. Cook rice
2. Fry beef and vegetables
3. Add kimchi and soy sauce
4. Add rice
5. Serve

name: Sun-young Park
description: Hello, I'm Sun-young Park. A South Korean Chef. As a chef, I have some awards like 'Best Korean Chef' 2018, Korean Restaurant Association. 'Asia's 50 Best Restaurants' 2019, William Reed Business Media. I believe in preserving the authenticity of traditional Korean cuisine while also innovating and experimenting with new techniques and ingredients. All I want to say is that you must try Traditional Korean cuisine.
cooking_method1:
1. Marinate beef in soy sauce, sugar, garlic, and sesame oil
2. Fry or grill beef
3. Serve
cooking_method2:
1. Mix flour, eggs, and water
2. Add seafood and green onions
3. Fry in oil
4. Serve
cooking_method3:
1. Mix flour, corn starch, and eggs
2. Coat chicken in mixture
3. Fry chicken
4. Serve with gochujang

name: Min-ji Lee
description: Hello, I'm Min-ji Lee. A South Korean Chef. As a chef, I have some awards like 'Best Korean Chef' 2018, Korean Restaurant Association. 'Asia's 50 Best Restaurants' 2019, William Reed Business Media. I believe in preserving the authenticity of traditional Korean cuisine while also innovating and experimenting with new techniques and ingredients. All I want to say is that you must try Traditional Korean cuisine.
cooking_method1:
1. Cut kimchi and beef into bite-sized pieces
2. Fry kimchi and beef in a pot
3. Add water and bring to boil
4. Add tofu, green onions, and gochugaru
5. Simmer for 10-15 minutes
6. Serve
cooking_method2:
1. Marinate beef ribs in soy sauce, sugar, garlic, and green onions
2. Grill or broil beef ribs
3. Serve
cooking_method3:
1. Cut chicken, sweet potato, and rice cake into bite-sized pieces
2. Fry chicken and vegetables in a pan
3. Add gochujang and garlic
4. Cook until chicken is fully cooked
5. Serve

name: Se-yeon
description: Hello, I'm Se-yeon. A South Korean Chef. As a chef, I have some awards like 'Best Korean Chef' 2018, Korean Restaurant Association. 'Asia's 50 Best Restaurants' 2019, William Reed Business Media. I believe in preserving the authenticity of traditional Korean cuisine while also innovating and experimenting with new techniques and ingredients. All I want to say is that you must try Traditional Korean cuisine.
cooking_method1:
1. Mix flour, yeast, sugar, and milk
2. Let the dough rise
3. Fill the dough with red bean paste
4. Cook in a special fish-shaped mold
5. Serve
cooking_method2:
1. Stuff chicken with rice, ginseng, jujube, and garlic
2. Boil chicken in a pot for about an hour
3. Serve with broth and garnishes
cooking_method3:
1. Fry seafood and vegetables in a pot
2. Add water and bring to boil
3. Add soft tofu, gochujang, and soy sauce
4. Simmer for 10-15 minutes
5. Serve

name: Seok-hoon Kim
description: Hello, I'm Seok-hoon Kim. A South Korean Chef. As a chef, I have some awards like 'Best Korean Chef' 2018, Korean Restaurant Association. 'Asia's 50 Best Restaurants' 2019, William Reed Business Media. I believe in preserving the authenticity of traditional Korean cuisine while also innovating and experimenting with new techniques and ingredients. All I want to say is that you must try Traditional Korean cuisine.
cooking_method1: Ssambap cakes in cold water for 20 minutes. Meanwhile, bring a pot of water to boil and cook fish cakes until they float to the surface. Drain and set aside. In a pan, combine rice cakes, fish cakes, gochujang, soy sauce, sugar, and enough water to cover. Cook over medium heat until sauce thickens and rice cakes are tender.
cooking_method2:
1. Soak soybeans overnight
2. Blend soaked soybeans with water
3. Strain the mixture
4. Cook noodles
5. Serve noodles in a bowl of soybean milk
6. Garnish with sliced cucumbers and sesame seeds
cooking_method3:
1. Soak noodles in water
2. Cook beef and vegetables separately
3. Boil noodles
4. Mix all ingredients with soy sauce and sesame oil
5. Serve
